content: अभिनिवेशः {@--1@} ({%a%}) Devotion, attachment, intentness, being occupied with, adherence to, close application, with <ab>loc.</ab> or in <ab>comp.</ab>; कतमस्मिंस्ते भावाभिनिवेशः <ls>V. 3</ls>; अहो निरर्थकव्यापारेष्वभिनिवेशः <ls>K. 120</ls>, <ls n="K.">146</ls>, <ls>Dk. 81</ls>; <ls>Māl. 7.</ls> ({%b%}) Firm attachment, love, fondness, affection; बलीयान् खलु मेऽभिनिवेशः <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; अनुरूपोऽस्या °शः {%<ab>ibid.</ab>%}, <ls>V. 2</ls>; असत्यभूते वस्तुन्यभिनिवेशः <ls>Mit.</ls> {@--2@} Earnest desire, ardent longing or expectation; wish, desire; <ls>Māl. 5. 27.</ls> {@--3@} Resolution, determined resolve, determination of purpose, firmness of resolve, perseverance; जनकात्मजायां नितांतरूक्षाभिनिवेशमीशं <ls>R. 14. 43</ls>; अनुरूप° शतोषिणा <ls>Ku. 5. 7</ls>; <ls>Śi. 3. 1.</ls> ({%b%}) Idea, thought; <ls>Ms. 12. 5</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 155.</ls> {@--4@} (In Yoga <ab>phil.</ab>) A sort of ignorance causing fear of death; instinctive clinging to worldly life and bodily enjoyments and the fear that one might be cut off from all of them by death; अविद्याऽ स्मितारागद्वेषाभिनिवेशाः पंचक्लेशाः <ls>Yoga S.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> also <ls>Sāṅ. K. 150</ls> and <ls>Malli.</ls> on <ls>Śi. 4. 55.</ls>
